properties.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 11 at 3:34PM EST until January 12 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Freezing rain producing ice accumulations around one
quarter inch are expected - especially north of M-59. Freezing
rain will mix with sleet and snow at time. Winds could gust as
high as 35 mph, which may further increase briefly Sunday
morning.

* WHERE...Livingston and Oakland Counties.

* WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the
ice and strong winds. Travel could become difficult.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are expected to fall to near
freezing this afternoon or early evening. The forecast for
freezing rain remains extremely sensitive to how far south the
sub-freezing air advances today and its timing. There will be a
sharp north to south gradient in ice accumulation totals across
Livingston and Oakland Counties. Flash freezing of wet roadways
is expected before sunrise.
properties.instruction:
Travel is discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency. Prepare for possible power outages.

NWSheadline: ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY
